parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Roads and Airports </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Object Detection </value></part><part><name>GROUP2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Find the road segments within the circle of given radius. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> pos '''nearRoads''' radius </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> pos: [[Object]] or [[Array]] in format [[PositionAGL]] or [[Position2D]], center of search radius </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> radius: [[Number]] - search radius in meters </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER3</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] of [[Object]]s - road segments within radius</value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 


</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_list = [[player]] [[nearRoads]] 50;</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_list = ([[position]] _unit) [[nearRoads]] 50;</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_list = [1800,5700] [[nearRoads]] 50;</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value> 

____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[isOnRoad]], [[roadAt]], [[surfaceIsWater]], [[roadsConnectedTo]], [[findNearestEnemy]], [[nearestBuilding]], [[nearestObject]], [[nearestObjects]], [[nearObjects]], [[nearestLocation]], [[nearEntities]], [[nearTargets]], [[nearSupplies]], [[nearestLocationWithDubbing]], [[nearObjectsReady]], [[getRoadInfo]], [[nearestTerrainObjects]]  </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="7"/><value>  </value></part><part><name>MPBEHAVIOUR</name>=<value> 
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part></template>

<h3 style='display:none'>Notes</h3>
<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on 26 Mar, 2011
<dt class="note">[[User:Tankbuster|Tankbuster ]]<dd class="note">
NearRoads always gets data in the same order. In a 300 meter radius around Feruz Abad, for example, the first one is in the south-west corner and the last one is in the north-east.
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
